name: Géza Grünwald
content:
Géza Grünwald (October 18, 1910, Budapest – September 7, 1943)  was a Hungarian[1] mathematician of Jewish heritage who worked on analysis. He died in the Holocaust.
 This article about a Hungarian scientist is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. This article about a mathematician is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
tags: Hungarian Jews who died in the Holocaust
Hungarian civilians killed in World War II
raw:
Hungarian mathematician
Géza Grünwald (October 18, 1910, Budapest – September 7, 1943)  was a Hungarian[1] mathematician of Jewish heritage who worked on analysis. He died in the Holocaust.

References[edit]


^ "The life and mathematics of Géza Grünwald". Technion-Israel Institute of Technology. Retrieved May 9, 2013.
